element.name: eml:eml
element.label: Ecological Metadata Language
element.description: Root Element of the Ecological Metadata Language

element.name: dataset
element.label: Dataset
element.description: The dataset metadata

element.name: alternateIdentifier
element.label: Metadata Identifier
element.description: This is an identifier for the metadata document; at least one of the identifiers should be a UUID

element.name: metadataProvider
element.label: Metadata Creator
element.description: The party responsible for the creation of the metadata document.

element.name: creator
element.label: Dataset Creator
element.description: The creator is the person who created the resource (not necessarily the author of this metadata about the resource).
element.help: This is the person or institution to contact with questions about the use, interpretation of a dataset.

element.name: contact
element.label: Dataset Contact
element.description: Current primary contact for the dataset. The creator of the resource might be dead, left the organisation or doesnt want to be bothered.
element.help: This is the person or institution to contact with questions about the use, interpretation of a dataset if the creator is unavailable/undefined.

element.name: organizationName
element.label: Organization Name
element.description: The full name of the organization that is associated with the resource.
element.help: This field is intended to describe which institution or overall organization is associated with the resource being described.

element.name: individualName
element.label: Individual Name
element.description: The name of an individual.
element.help: This field is intended to be used instead of a particular person or full organization name. If the associated person who holds the role changes frequently, then Position Name would be used for consistency. E.g., GBIF Data Manager.

element.name: associatedParty
element.label: Associated Party
element.description: A party associated with the resource.

element.name: pubDate
element.label: Publication Date
element.description: The date on which the resource was published

element.name: language
element.label: Resource Language
element.description: The language in which the resource (not the metadata document) is written
element.help: Taken from Default Languages loaded into GeoNetwork.

element.name: abstract
element.label: Abstract
element.description: A brief overview describing the dataset

element.name: keywordSet
element.label: Keywords
element.description: A wrapper element for the keyword and keywordThesaurus elements

element.name: keyword
element.label: Keyword
element.description: This field names a keyword or key phrase that concisely describes the resource or is related to the resource.
element.help: Each keyword field should contain one and only one keyword

element.name: keywordThesaurus
element.label: Thesaurus
element.description: The name of the official keyword thesaurus from which keyword was derived

element.name: additionalInfo
element.label: Additional Info
element.description: Any information that is not characterized by the other resource metadata fields

element.name: intellectualRights
element.label: Intellectual Rights
element.description: Contain a rights management statement for the resource, or reference a service providing such information

element.name: coverage
element.label: Extent
element.description: Describes the extent of the coverage of the resource in terms of its spatial extent, temporal extent, and taxonomic extent

element.name: geographicCoverage
element.label: Geographic Extent
element.description: A container for spatial information about a resource; allows a bounding box for the overall coverage (in lat long), and also allows description of arbitrary polygons with exclusions.

element.name: geographicDescription
element.label: Geographic Description
element.description: A short text description of a dataset's geographic areal domain. A text description is especially important to provide a geographic setting when the extent of the dataset cannot be well described by the "boundingCoordinates".

element.name: boundingCoordinates
element.label: Bounding Box
element.description: Bounding Coordinates are the four margins (N, S, E, W) of a bounding box, or when considered in lat-lon pairs, the corners of the box.

element.name: westBoundingCoordinate
element.label: West Bounding Coordinate
element.description: The westBoundingCoordinate field defines the longitude of the western-most point of the bounding box that is being described.

element.name: eastBoundingCoordinate
element.label: East Bounding Coordinate
element.description: The eastBoundingCoordinate field defines the longitude of the eastern-most point of the bounding box that is being described.

element.name: northBoundingCoordinate
element.label: North Bounding Coordinate
element.description: The northBoundingCoordinate field defines the latitude of the northern-most point of the bounding box that is being described.

element.name: southBoundingCoordinate
element.label: South Bounding Coordinate
element.description: The southBoundingCoordinate field defines the latitude of the southern-most point of the bounding box that is being described.

element.name: temporalCoverage
element.label: Temporal Extent
element.description: This field specifies temporal coverage, and allows coverages to be a single point in time, multiple points in time, or a range of dates.

element.name: rangeOfDates
element.label: Range of Dates
element.description: The 'RangeOfDates' field is intended to be used for describing a range of dates and/or times. It may be used multiple times to document multiple date ranges. It allows for two 'singleDateTime' fields, the first to be used as the beginning dateTime, and the second to be used as the ending dateTime of the range.

element.name: beginDate
element.label: Begin Date
element.description: A single time stamp signifying the beginning of some time period

element.name: endDate
element.label: End Date
element.description: A single time stamp signifying the end of some time period

element.name: singleDateTime
element.label: Single Date Time
element.description: The SingleDateTime field is intended to describe a single date and time for an event

element.name: taxonomicCoverage
element.label: Taxonomic Extent
element.description: Taxonomic Coverage is a container for taxonomic information about a resource. It includes a list of species names (or higher level ranks) from one or more classification systems.

element.name: generalTaxonomicCoverage
element.label: General Taxonomic Coverage
element.description: A general description of the range of taxa addressed in the data set or collection

element.name: taxonomicClassification
element.label: Taxonomic Classification
element.description: Information about the range of taxa addressed in the dataset or collection

element.name: taxonRankName
element.label: Taxonomic Rank Name
element.description: The name of the taxonomic rank for which the Taxon rank value is provided, e.g., Phylum, Class, Genus, Species

element.name: taxonRankValue
element.label: Taxonomic Rank Value
element.description: The name representing the taxonomic rank of the taxon being described

element.name: commonName
element.label: Common Name
element.description: Applicable common names; these common names may be general descriptions of a group of organisms if appropriate, e.g., invertebrates, waterfowl

element.name: purpose
element.label: Purpose
element.description: A description of the purpose of the resource/dataset

element.name: methods
element.label: Methods
element.description: The methods field documents scientific methods used in the collection of this dataset. It includes information on items such as tools, instrument calibration and software.

element.name: methodStep
element.label: Method Step
element.description: The methodStep field allows for repeated sets of elements that document a series of procedures followed to produce a data object. These include text descriptions of the procedures, relevant literature, software, instrumentation, source data and any quality control measures taken.

element.name: qualityControl
element.label: Quality Control
element.description: The qualityControl field provides a location for the description of actions taken to either control or assess the quality of data resulting from the associated method step.

element.name: sampling
element.label: Sampling
element.description: Description of sampling procedures including the geographic, temporal and taxonomic coverage of the study.

element.name: studyExtent
element.label: Study Extent
element.description: The field studyExtent represents both a specific sampling area and the sampling frequency (temporal boundaries, frequency of occurrence). The geographic studyExtent is usually a surrogate (representative area of) for the larger area documented in the "studyAreaDescription".

element.name: samplingDescription
element.label: Sampling Description
element.description: The samplingDescription field allows for a text-based/human readable description of the sampling procedures used in the research project. The content of this element would be similar to a description of sampling procedures found in the methods section of a journal article.

element.name: project
element.label: Project
element.description: The project field contains information on the project in which this dataset was collected. It includes information such as project personnel, funding, study area, project design and related projects.

element.name: personnel
element.label: Personnel
element.description: The Personnel field extends ResponsibleParty with role information and is used to document people involved in a research project by providing contact information and their role in the project.

element.name: funding
element.label: Funding
element.description: The funding field is used to provide information about funding sources for the project such as: grant and contract numbers; names and addresses of funding sources.

element.name: studyAreaDescription
element.label: Study Area Description
element.description: The studyAreaDescription field documents the physical area associated with the research project. It can include descriptions of the geographic, temporal, and taxonomic coverage of the research location and descriptions of domains (themes) of interest such as climate, geology, soils or disturbances.

element.name: designDescription
element.label: Design Description
element.description: The field designDescription contains general textual descriptions of research design. It can include detailed accounts of goals, motivations, theory, hypotheses, strategy, statistical design, and actual work.

element.name: descriptor
element.label: Descriptor
element.description: The descriptor field is used to document domains (themes) of interest such as climate, geology, soils or disturbances.

element.name: citableClassificationSystem
element.label: Citable Classification System
element.description: Does the descriptor value used belong to a citable classification system?

element.name: name
element.label: Name
element.description: The name of the classification system to which the descriptor value belongs.

element.name: descriptorValue
element.label: Descriptor Value
element.description: The descriptorValue field contains a general description, either thematic or geographic, of the study area.

element.name: additionalMetadata
element.label: Additional Metadata
element.description: A flexible field for including any other relevant metadata that pertains to the resource being described. This field allows EML to be extensible in that any XML-based metadata can be included in this element.

element.name: metadata
element.label: Metadata
element.description: This element contains the additional metadata to be included in the document. This element should be used for extending EML to include metadata that is not already available in another part of the EML specification.

element.name: gbif
element.label: GBIF Metadata Block
element.description: A block of additional metadata used for some special GBIF purposes and crossmapping to other schemas like the TDWG Natural Collection Data (NCD) schema

element.name: dateStamp
element.label: Date Stamp
element.description: The date the metadata document was created or modified.

element.name: citation
element.label: Citation
element.description: A single citation for use when citing the dataset

element.name: identifier
element.label: Identifier
element.description: A URI, DOI or other persistent identifier for the citation

element.name: bibliography
element.label: Bibliography
element.description: A list of citations that form a bibliography on literature related / used in the dataset

element.name: physical
element.label: Physical
element.description: A container element for all of the elements that let you describe the internal/external characteristics and distribution of a data object (e.g., dataObject, dataFormat, distribution) .

element.name: resourceLogoUrl
element.label: Resource Logo URL
element.description: URL of the logo associated with a resource

element.name: collection
element.label: Collection
element.description: A container element for other elements associated with collections (e.g., collectionIdentifier, collectionName).

element.name: parentCollectionIdentifier
element.label: Parent Collection Identifier
element.description: Identifier for the parent collection for this sub-collection. Enables a hierarchy of collections and sub collections to be built.

element.name: collectionIdentifier
element.label: Collection Identifier
element.description: The URI (LSID or URL) of the collection. In RDF, used as URI of the collection resource.

element.name: collectionName
element.label: Collection Name
element.description: Official name of the Collection in the local language

element.name: formationPeriod
element.label: Formation Period
element.description: Text description of the time period during which the collection was assembled e.g. "Victorian", or "1922 - 1932", or "c. 1750".

element.name: specimenPreservationMethod
element.label: Speciment Preservation Method
element.description: Picklist keyword indicating the process or technique used to prevent physical deterioration of non-living collections. Expected to contain a value from the GBIF Specimen Preservation Method vocabulary

element.name: livingTimePeriod
element.label: Living Time Period
element.description: Time period during which biological material was alive. (for palaeontological collections)

element.name: jgtiCuratorialUnit
element.label: JGTI Curatorial Unit
element.description: A quantitative descriptor (number of specimens, samples or batches).

element.name: jgtiUnitType
element.label: JGTI Unit Type
element.description: A general description of the unit of curation, e.g., 'jar containing plankton sample'.

element.name: jgtiUnits
element.label: JGTI Units
element.description: The exact number of units within the collection

element.name: uncertaintyMeasure
element.label: JGTI Units Uncertainty
element.description: A measure of the uncertainty (+ or -) x associated with the jgtiUnits value

element.name: jgtiUnitRange
element.label: JGTI Unit Range
element.description: A range of numbers (x to x), with the lower value representing an exact number, when the higher value is omitted.

element.name: beginRange
element.label: Begin Range
element.description: The lower value in a range of numbers. Use to represent an exact number by omitting the "endRange" value.

element.name: endRange
element.label: End Range
element.description: The upper value in a range of numbers.

element.name: objectName
element.label: Object Name
element.description: The name of the data object. This often is the filename of a file in a file system or that is accessible on the network.

element.name: characterEncoding
element.label: Character Encoding
element.description: This element contains the name of the character encoding. This is typically ASCII or UTF-8, or one of the other common encodings.

element.name: dataFormat
element.label: Data Format
element.description: This is a container element for other elements which describe the internal physical characteristics of the data object.

element.name: externallyDefinedFormat
element.label: Externally Defined Format
element.description: Information about a non-text or proprietary formatted object.

element.name: formatName
element.label: Format Name
element.description: Name of the format of the data object, e.g., ESRI Shapefile.

element.name: formatVersion
element.label: Format Version
element.description: Version of the format of the data object

element.name: title
element.label: Title
element.description: The 'title' field provides a description of the resource that is being documented that is long enough to differentiate it from other similar resources. Multiple titles may be provided, particularly when trying to express the title in more than one language (use the "xml:lang" attribute to indicate the language if not English/en).

element.name: individualName
element.label: Individual Name
element.description: The individualName field contains subfields so that a person's name can be broken down into parts.

element.name: givenName
element.label: Given Name
element.description: The given name field can be used for first name of the individual associated with the resource, or for any other names that are not intended to be alphabetized, (as appropriate).

element.name: surName
element.label: Surname
element.description: The surname field is used for the last name of the individual associated with the resource. This is typically the family name of an individual, for example, the name by which s/he is referred to in citations.

element.name: address
element.label: Address
element.description: The address field is a container for multiple subfields that describe the physical or electronic address of the responsible party for a resource.

element.name: deliveryPoint
element.label: Delivery Point
element.description: The delivery point field is used for the physical address for postal communication, e.g., GBIF Secretariat, Universitetsparken 15

element.name: city
element.label: City
element.description: The city field is used for the city name of the contact associated with a particular resource.

element.name: administrativeArea
element.label: Administrative Area
element.description: The administrative area field is the equivalent of a 'state' in the U.S., or Province in Canada. This field is intended to accommodate the many types of international administrative areas.

element.name: postalCode
element.label: Postal Code
element.description: The postal code is equivalent to a U.S. zip code, or the number used for routing to an international address.

element.name: country
element.label: Country
element.description: The country field is used for the name of the contact's country.

element.name: phone
element.label: Phone
element.description: The phone field describes information about the responsible party's telephone, be it a voice phone, fax.

element.name: electronicMailAddress
element.label: Email
element.description: The electronic mail address is the email address for the party. It is intended to be an Internet SMTP email address, which should consist of a username followed by the @ symbol, followed by the email server domain name address.

element.name: onlineUrl
element.label: Online URL
element.description: A link to associated online information, usually a web site. When the party represents an organization, this is the URL to a website or other online information about the organization. If the party is an individual, it might be their personal web site or other related online information about the party.

element.name: role
element.label: Role
element.description: Use this field to describe the role the party played with respect to the resource. Some potential roles include technician, reviewer, principal investigator, and many others.

element.name: para
element.label: Paragraph
element.description: The "paragraph" element allows for text blocks to be included in EML.

element.name: distribution
element.label: Distribution
element.description: This element provides information on how the resource is distributed. When used at the resource level, this element can provide only general information, but elements for describing connections to online systems are provided.

element.name: online
element.label: Online
element.description: This element contains information for accessing the resource online represented as a URL connection

element.name: url
element.label: URL
element.description: The URL of the resource that is available online.

element.name: function
element.label: Resource type
element.description: The type of resource in a url element.

element.name: calendarDate
element.label: Calendar Date
element.description: The calendar date field is used to express a date, giving the year, month, and day. The format should be one that complies with the International Standards Organization's standard 8601. The recommended format for EML is YYYY-MM-DD, where Y is the four digit year, M is the two digit month code (01 - 12, where January = 01), and D is the two digit day of the month (01 - 31). This field can also be used to enter just the year portion of a date.

element.name: description
element.label: Description
element.description: The field Description contains general textual descriptions.

element.name: xml:lang
element.label: Language
element.description: This attribute indicates the language of the field.
